commands.title: Run the planner and display the plan

pddlParser.executableOrService.description: PDDL parser for syntactical analysis. Specify executable location or service URL e.g. parser.exe, validate.exe, or http://localhost:8090/parse.

pddlParser.executableOptions.description: Override the command-line options passed to the PDDL parser configured in 'pddlParser.executableOrService'.

pddlParser.problemPattern.description: Pattern to match onto the parser output to extract the parsing problems. The syntax must be: '/regex/flags/order'. See more info at https://github.com/jan-dolejsi/vscode-pddl/wiki/Configuring-the-PDDL-parser

pddlParser.pddlParserService.description: Obsolete: please remove configuration values manually.

pddlParser.delayInSecondsBeforeParsing.description: Delay in seconds the Language Server should wait after a PDDL file is modified before calls the parser.

pddlParser.maxNumberOfProblems.description: Controls the maximum number of problems produced by the server.

pddlParser.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the language server.

pddlPlanner.executableOrService.title: Planner executable or service URL
pddlPlanner.executableOrService.description: Enter the planner executable (e.g. planner.exe) with full path unless you have its location included in the %path% environment variable. If you are using a parsing service, make sure it starts with http: or https:

pddlPlanner.epsilonTimeStep.title: Default epsilon time step used by your planner.
pddlPlanner.epsilonTimeStep.description: Default epsilon time step used by your planner. This is used when interpreting/visualizing the plan.
